bow: at what age did your children start helping out around the house when did they start cleaning up their own toys my daughters 16 months old and ve already started having her do the basics she picks up her toys puts her soppy cups in the sink when done and throws away her trash napkins and such she young so doesn always do it but felt it was important to introduce responsibilities earlier 15months old she watched me do it long enough and started her own version of sorting and organising things guided that into clean up time and now 17mo she understands putting things back where they came from she helps load unload the dishwasher supervised and after take away sharp things and she learned how to wipe up her face after eating and wipe the crumbs off her table she sometimes helps with laundry sorting into piles and loading it in pushing the buttons but gets bored and not going to force any of this on toddler this young for looooong time she has been obsessed with the vacuum cleaner so we got her mini dyson one that is actually functional 🙌🏻🙌🏻🙌🏻🙌🏻 credit all of this to waiting until she on her own showed interest in sorting organising and being part of what we do around the house we keep it light and fun and come up with songs for all the chores constantly praise her effort and tell her how helpful she is made putting toys away game we played as soon as they could walk at my daughter loved to dust low shelves with sock over her hand that had drawn eyes and mouth on mr gobble loved to eat dust my kids loved soapy sponges gave them one each and they wiped the counter where they had just eaten after every meal if spilled something during meal prep would make sound like an alarm and shout spill emergency kitchen rescue other things they did before the age of put clean dishes away in low cabinets take clean laundry to their rooms sort socks they loved sticking their head and arms into warm dryer sometimes we would sing or make it race never called it work it was just different kind of fun gosh miss those days my son is just over and he gets excited if ask him to help with housework granted he not much help with most stuff but he into it lol he cleaned up his toys for the first time this week without me asking more than once my 27 month old unloads the dishwasher take the knives out first she puts the wash into the dryer she puts her toys away 40 percent of the time and lives to sweep with her little broom granted things always end up kessler than when we started bit she loves helping mommy and cleaning lol about one and half she started with wiping our phone screens with microfiber cloth and progressed to using wipes to clean her bigger toys it waste of wipes since she wipes only once but so adorable that we just let her do it they started helping at around 18 months but my oldest is and it still struggle so as babies my kids helped by doing little things like handing me dishes to it away sweeping with their brooms etc but my almost year old is finally getting to the point where she will independently put things away when tell her to clean up without me having to help or guide her the whole time before as soon as he was able to help at he very competent he can effectively sweep wash dry sort laundry with help but he knows the steps wipe counters table clean up toys etc he still learning but he genuinely contributes our kids were probably around 18 months when we started having them help put their own toys away our 19 month old helps pick up his toys loves to help vacuum and sweep helps unload the dishwasher and is obsessed with helping put away groceries toddlers love to help so we just try to encourage what he already doing at this stage him helping generally makes task take twice as long but we re hoping it pays off down the road my kiddo is and he just now starting to do real chores like helping unload the dishwasher and scoop the pet poop he also in charge of keeping his room clean and cleaning up after his dishes or toys in the living room would say the same about year and half could get my daughter to start picking up her toys to throw in bin she is now and these are her jobs make her bed or that her room is mess and she can really play if all her toys are out my two year old has been helping for while now she helps pick up her toys and loves to sing the clean up song while we do it she takes things to the trash all the time even things that do go in the trash and every time mop sweep or dust she has to whip out her melissa and doug cleaning supplies and do it with me when was
